Steve Horstmeyer FOX 8 Steve is a seasoned meteorologist based in Cincinnati, with a career that spans over three decades. A graduate of Moeller High School, he initially began his professional journey as a mathematics teacher in the Cincinnati Public Schools system. However, his passion for weather soon led him to transition into television, where he took on the roles of both meteorologist and reporter.
In addition to his broadcasting career, Steve has remained active in academia. He currently serves as an adjunct instructor in the Department of Chemistry at the College of Mount St. Joseph. His teaching experience also extends to the University of Cincinnati and Miami University, where he has shared his expertise with students.
Horstmeyer is a respected voice in the field of meteorology and is widely published. He frequently contributes to Weatherwise, a magazine produced by the non-profit Helen Dwight Reed Educational Foundation. His work has earned him significant recognition, including the prestigious American Meteorological Society seal for both television and radio broadcasting.
